title.narrative: Design Advisory Services for Mozambique-Zambia 400kV Transmission Interconnector, through Power Engineers, Inc.

description.narrative: This technical assistance provides transmission design advisory services in relation to the planned Mozambique-Zambia 400 kilovolt transmission interconnector, namely the detailed design and technical inputs for the tender documents for the engineering, procurement and construction contractor. The Project entails the construction of a 400 kV high-voltage transmission line of approximately 368 kilometers (km) between Mozambique and Zambia to facilitate the flow of electrical power in either direction.

The Workshop will cover a broad range of technical topics and include ICT officials from African countries, with a particular focus on USTDA's priority markets in the region. The Workshop will serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government engage African counterparts to collaborate on opportunities, challenges, best practices, and policy development for the region's ICT sector. title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - African Leaders Visit: Energy, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: USTDA supported the African Leaders' Visit: Energy to serve as an official side event for the U.S.-Africa Leaders' Summit in Washington, DC in August 2014. The Visit allowed the high-level delegates from Kenya and Tanzania to engage in dialogue on the U.S. experience with natural gas to inform their decisions on developing their natural gas reserves in a way that is beneficial to their countries. The Visit also emphasized the need for good governance and transparency to ensure a sound marketplace. Site visits near Houston, TX showcased gas infrastructure installations and pipeline architecture.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - African Leaders Visit: Transportation, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: USTDA supported the African Leaders' Visit: Transportation to serve as an official side event for the U.S.-Africa Leaders' Summit in Washington, DC in August 2014. The Visit allowed the high-level delegates from Algeria, Ethiopia, South Africa, Angola, Nigeria, and the Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa to engage in dialogue on the U.S. experience and lessons learned in the aviation and rail sectors. The Visit introduced the delegates to policymakers, financiers, technical experts, and equipment and services suppliers from the U.S. aviation and rail sectors. Meetings and site visits showcased Chicago, IL's position as a rail and aviation hub and offered participants a chance to observe advanced transportation infrastructure.

title.narrative: Technical Symposium - INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATIONS TECHNOLOGY CONFERENCE - BRIEFING BOOK, through Computer Frontiers, Inc.

description.narrative: USTDA is providing $150,000 for development of a Briefing Book in support of the Sub-Saharan Africa ("SSA") Information and Communications Technology ("ICT") Conference. The Conference highlights ICT sector opportunities and policy developments in a number of countries in the region. The Conference also promotes development of infrastructure, technology transfer and market-oriented reforms in the communications and IT sector. Topics include deregulation, privatization, connectivity, public-sector reforms, security, and capacity building. The event enables delegates from SSA to interact with and discuss project ideas with potential U.S. suppliers. The Conference took place in San Francisco in October 2006.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - REGIONAL RAIL INTEGRATION PROJECT, through Government - Country unknown

description.narrative: This $750,000 feasibility study (FS) assists the Union Economique et Monetaire Ouest-Africaine/West African Economic and Monetary Union (UEMOA) in determining the technical and economic viability of developing the proposed rail line from Bamako, Mali to Mali's southeastern border with Cote d'Ivoire, as well as its associated costs, design and construction criteria, and implementation plan. The proposed railway would interconnect two existing railways, thus providing a reliable transport link for land-locked Burkina Faso to the Port of Dakar, Senegal.

description.narrative: This $65,000 definitional mission identifies and evaluates opportunities in the energy sector in Kenya, Tanzania and Rwanda for USTDA funding consideration, with special focus on indentifying projects that fit with USTDA's current priority of prompting clean energy and combating climate change. title.narrative: Technical Symposium - EAST AFRICAN COMMUNITY E-HEALTH WORKSHOP, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This Activity provides $395,000 for a three day workshop (Technical Symposium, or TS) in East Africa focused on e-health. This project, which falls under USTDA's East Africa Broadband Connectivity Initiative (EABCI), is designed to bring together decision-makers from both the public and private sectors responsible for overseeing and delivering healthcare solutions to the five East African Community (EAC) countries (Kenya, Rwanda, Burundi, Tanzania and Uganda) to learn about policy issues, technology issues and broadband solutions that will enable them to improve healthcare infrastructure and delivery via the use of broadband technology.
